data.title: Victor Hugo – Audio Books, Best Sellers, Author Bio
data.meta_description: Learn more about Victor Hugo. Browse Victor Hugo’s best-selling audiobooks and newest titles. Discover more authors you’ll love listening to on Audible.
data.text:
Les Misérables

Penguin Classics

By: Christine Donougher, Victor Hugo, Robert Tombs

Narrated by: Adeel Akhtar, Natalie Simpson, Adrian Scarborough, and others

Length: 65 hrs and 41 mins

Unabridged

Overall

5 out of 5 stars 207

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 182

Story

5 out of 5 stars 180

Victor Hugo's tale of injustice, heroism and love follows the fortunes of Jean Valjean, an escaped convict determined to put his criminal past behind him....

5 out of 5 stars

Great Book, Great Translation, 5 Great Narrators

By Rain Wiegartner on 06-07-20

Les Miserables

By: Victor Hugo

Narrated by: Frederick Davidson

Length: 57 hrs and 48 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4.5 out of 5 stars 2,246

Performance

4.5 out of 5 stars 1,563

Story

4.5 out of 5 stars 1,576

Set in the Parisian underworld and plotted like a detective story, Les Miserables follows Jean Valjean, originally an honest peasant, who has been imprisoned for 19 years....

4 out of 5 stars

one happy insomniac

By Kathryn on 01-27-05

One of the great classics of world literature and the inspiration for the most beloved stage musical of all time, Les Misérables is legendary author Victor Hugo’s masterpiece....

5 out of 5 stars

A Book that Made Me a Better Person

By Jeff Diamond on 03-29-13

Les Misérables is set in Paris after the French Revolution. In the sewers and backstreets, we encounter "the wolf-like tread of crime"....

3 out of 5 stars

Use earphones that are light on bass

The year is 1793. The French Revolution is at its bloodiest, under attack from within by Royalists and from without by foreign armies. If England successfully lands its army in France, the Republic is likely doomed....

5 out of 5 stars

A must read

By j daly on 11-26-19

Les Misérables' hero is Jean Valjean, the noble peasant imprisoned. A sweeping story of love and honor in the depths of the Parisian underworld....

2 out of 5 stars

too short

The Man Who Laughs (“L’Homme qui Rit”) was called by its author “A Romance of English History,” and was written during the period Hugo spent in exile in Guernsey....

3 out of 5 stars

Great performance, dreadful book

By Salwesab on 06-16-23

Les Misérables

By: Victor Hugo, Isabel F. Hapgood - translator

Narrated by: Pete Cross

Length: 62 hrs and 45 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4.5 out of 5 stars 16

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 15

Story

4.5 out of 5 stars 15

Les Miserables, which was published in 1862, is a sprawling historical and philosophical epic that covers from 1815 through the Paris Uprising in 1832. Notable for its many subplots and digressions from the main storyline, the novel's stated aim is a progress from evil to good....

5 out of 5 stars

Incredible Book

By A. M. Dirks on 08-04-19

The Hunchback of Notre Dame

By: Victor Hugo, Isabel Florence Hapgood - translator

Narrated by: Simon Vance

Length: 18 hrs and 35 mins

Unabridged

Overall

5 out of 5 stars 1

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 1

Story

5 out of 5 stars 1

A mad priest, a vagabond playwright, a social-climbing soldier, and a deformed bell-ringer—all are captivated by a gypsy girl's beauty and charm. Two of them will betray her, but the others will remain loyal, even in the shadow of the gallows....
